H0.text: That travel through the object is the color of an object such as an apple.

H1.text: The color of an object such as an apple is the same as the color of the light waves that are absorbed by the object.

H2.text: The color that is reflected by an object such as an apple is the same as the color of the light waves.

H3.text: The light waves that travel around the object are the color of an object such as an apple, which is the same as the color.

A4.text: The reflectance is the fraction of incident electromagnetic power that is reflected at the boundary.

A5.text: Most objects do not reflect or transmit light specularly and to some degree scatters the incoming light, which is called glossiness.

A6.text: Atoms emit and absorb light at characteristic energies. This produces 'emission lines' in the spectrum of each atom.
